result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David W. Ray

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[MK; Court Reporter-Mary Heederik] 
cases #22CF371, #22CF458, #22CT32, #22CM284 called at 8:40am.
Defendant David W. Ray in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court appoints Attorney Huebner as counsel on Cases #22CT322, 22CM284. The same repayment order as set in the other cases applies to these cases. 

As to Cases #22CF371 and #22CF458 Prelim-Waiver and Arraignment is held: 
--Mr. Ray waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--service of Informations admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

As to Case #22CM284 Initial Appearance is held:  
--The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
--Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
--Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived by both parties.
--The Court requires $750  Signature Bond, with conditions:
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the case with the Victim 1 as referred to in the Criminal Complaint and the Victim Witness Key 
recess 8:49am 

NEXT:   (1) appointment of Attorney Huebner in Cases #22CT322 and #22CM284, (2) Status Conference on December 15th at 3:30pm

Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 2:53 PM 
Defendant David W. Ray in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for David W. Ray.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance. 

The Court reviews the court record. 

Parties waive preliminary hearing time limits

Scheduling is discussed. 

State has no objection Mr. Ray appearing via zoom for Waiver of Prelim.
recess: 2:58pm 
NEXT: (1)Pretrial on 9/28/22 at 9:00am (2)Preliminary Hearing on 10/21/22 at 8:30am

No Reimbursement Required

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:11 PM 
Defendant David W. Ray appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.

The Court tolls time limits

Bond Arguments given by Counsel
Statement given by Witness 1

The Court requires a $5000  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the case with Victim 1 or Witness 1
--not to discipline any child, physical or otherwise

recess 2:19  pm. 

NEXT: Status of Counsel on 9/8/22 at 3:00pm

Order to Seal Victim Key
